alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Denali; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 7:14PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Cold Over Interior Alaska This Week... ...Windy Over Interior Summits Tuesday Into Wednesday... Valleys across the Interior will see low temperatures of 15 to 30 below tonight through Friday, while hills will have lows of 5 to 15 below. Both hill and valley locations will have highs of zero to 10 above Tuesday through Friday. A warming trend is expected this weekend. Northeast winds are expected to develop across the Interior on Tuesday and continue into Wednesday. Most location will have winds of 5 to 15 mph. Interior highway summits such as Finger Mountain and Atigun Pass on the Dalton Highway, Ptarmagin Pass on the Elliott Highway, and Eagle Summit on the Steese Highway can expect gusts to 35 mph Tuesday through Wednesday. These summits will have blowing and drifting snow Tuesday into Wednesday along with wind chills to 50 below on Tuesday night. Snow drifts may make travel difficult over these summits. People traveling over Summits of the Steese, Elliott and Dalton Highways on Tuesday and Wednesday should be prepared for large snow drifts and very cold wind chills. Winds are expected to decrease Wednesday night.
